import java.util.*;
public class MyClassOne
{
public static Set getIntersection(Set

TEST_CASE.TEST_SCRIPT: @Test public void getIntersectionTest1(){Set<Object> temp_array1 = new HashSet();temp_array1.add("Ian Darwin");temp_array1.add("Bill Dooley");temp_array1.add("Jesse James");Set<Object> temp_array2 = new HashSet(); temp_array2.add("Ian Darwin"); temp_array2.add("Bill Dooley"); temp_array2.add("Doolin' Dalton");Set<Object> temp_answer = new HashSet(); temp_answer.add("Ian Darwin");temp_answer.add("Bill Dooley");Assert.assertEquals(temp_answer, getIntersection(temp_array1, temp_array2));}

@Test public void getIntersectionTest2(){Set<Object> temp_array1 = new HashSet();temp_array1.add("Ian Darwin");temp_array1.add("Bill Dooley");temp_array1.add("Jesse James");Set<Object> temp_array2 = new HashSet(); temp_array2.add("Bill Gats"); temp_array2.add("james Gosling"); temp_array2.add("Doolin' Dalton");Set<Object> temp_answer = new HashSet();Assert.assertEquals(temp_answer, getIntersection(temp_array1, temp_array2));}

@Test public void getIntersectionTest3(){Set<Object> temp_array1 = new HashSet();temp_array1.add("Ian Darwin");temp_array1.add("Bill Dooley");temp_array1.add("Jesse James");Set<Object> temp_array2 = new HashSet(); temp_array2.add("iAN dARWIN"); temp_array2.add("bILL dOOLEY"); temp_array2.add("Doolin' Dalton");Set<Object> temp_answer = new HashSet(); Assert.assertEquals(temp_answer, getIntersection(temp_array1, temp_array2));}

@Test public void getIntersectionTest4(){Set<Object> temp_array1 = new HashSet();temp_array1.add("Bill Gats"); temp_array1.add("Abrahim Linken");temp_array1.add("Jesse James");Set<Object> temp_array2 = new HashSet(); temp_array2.add("Abrahim Linken"); temp_array2.add("Jesse James"); temp_array2.add("Bill Gats");Set<Object> temp_answer = new HashSet();temp_answer.add("Bill Gats"); temp_answer.add("Abrahim Linken");temp_answer.add("Jesse James");Assert.assertEquals(temp_answer, getIntersection(temp_array1, temp_array2));}

@Test public void getIntersectionTest5(){Set<Object> temp_array1 = new HashSet();temp_array1.add("Bi ll Gats"); temp_array1.add("Ab rahim Linken");temp_array1.add("Je sse James");Set temp_array2 = new HashSet();temp_array2.add("Bill Ga ts"); temp_array2.add("Abrahim Lin ken"); temp_array2.add("Jesse Ja mes");Set<Object> temp_answer = new HashSet();Assert.assertEquals(temp_answer, getIntersection(temp_array1, temp_array2));}

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: What will happen if you change a class while your Java application is running. Assume that the instance of this class has been already created by the application when change was made.

OPTIONS.OPTION: The changes made to the class would be reflected in the application since the byte code has changed
The changes made to the class would not be reflected in the class as the class is loaded in the memory
When the class change is detected, JVM reloads the class
When class change is detected, your application would crash
JVM loads the class only once, so the change would not be detected

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: When is static block of a class called

OPTIONS.OPTION: Static block of a class is called when the class is loaded
Static block gets called as soon as application containing that class is started, irrespective of whether that class is referred or not
Static block gets called, when you refer to the class first time in the application lifecycle
Static block gets called every time when you create instance of the class
Static block gets called only once during execution of JVM

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: How is ARP (Address resolution protocol) used in network communication.

OPTIONS.OPTION: When you browse a website (google.com), your computer uses ARP to get MAC address (physical address) of that website

ARP is only used only within a physical network where computers are directly connected to each other using a switch or hub. So for getting Mac address(physical address) of external website (Google.com), ARP is not used by your computer
ARP is used to get MAC address (physical address) of a computer using its IP address
ARP is used to get IP address of a computer using its MAC address (physical address)
When computer wants to directly/physically communicate with another computer it requires its physical address which is retrieved using ARP
